definition: surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: When he was travelling across Romania, he fell into company with a party of gipsies.
sentences.chinese: 他在罗马尼亚旅行时结识了一群吉卜赛人。

sentences.english: People used to be afraid of that the gypsies might carry their children off.
sentences.chinese: 人们过去总害怕吉卜赛人会把他们的孩子拐走。

sentences.english: The gipsy produced three tin cups, and filled them to the brim with brandy.
sentences.chinese: 吉卜赛人取出三只锡杯，斟满了白兰地。

sentences.english: She has pure gypsy blood in her veins.
sentences.chinese: 她血管里流的是纯吉卜赛人的血液。

sentences.english: I saw a real, live Gipsy when I was ten.
sentences.chinese: 我十岁时见过一个真正的活着的吉卜赛人。

sentences.english: I must go down to the seas again, to the vagrant gypsy life.
sentences.chinese: 我得重下海去，生活像漂泊的吉卜赛人一样。

sentences.english: On arriving at the spot, he found that the gypsies had gone. (Wilde)
sentences.chinese: 他赶到那里时发现那些吉卜赛人已经走了。

sentences.english: A traveller came out of the airport.
sentences.chinese: 一个吉卜赛人传出的机场。

sentences.english: Delicately built and slim, she had a gypsy beauty about her.
sentences.chinese: 她娇小玲珑，有吉卜赛人的美。

sentences.english: The gypsy was inclined to stay in the town.
sentences.chinese: 吉卜赛人打算留居镇上。

sentences.english: However, gipsy but don't think so.
sentences.chinese: 然而，吉卜赛人却不这么想。

sentences.english: Some Gypsies live on reading a person's hand.
sentences.chinese: 一些吉卜赛人靠给别人看手相为生。

sentences.english: He said that all the other boys were regular gipsies.
sentences.chinese: 他说别的男孩全是道地的吉卜赛人。

definition: Romani, an ethnic group of Europe
Bohemia, historical country of central Europe
the Sami people, indigenous people in northern Scandinavia
